required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimization of the Acquisition Sequence to Improve the Quality and Comfort of Magnetic Resonance Imaging Exam
clinical_study.official_title: Optimization of the Acquisition Sequence to Improve the Quality and Comfort of Magnetic Resonance Imaging Exam

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the optimization of MRI acquisition sequences.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality based on standard imaging quality criteria.
primary_outcome.description: The image quality will be appreciated visually at least by a radiologist or a researcher.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the Signal to Noise Ratio obtained by the optimized MRI sequence and the reference situation (standard sequence).
secondary_outcome.description: Signal to Noise Ratio will be measured in arbitrary units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the Contrast to Noise Ratio obtained by the optimized MRI sequence and the reference situation (standard sequence).
secondary_outcome.description: Contrast to Noise Ratio will be measured in arbitrary units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the acquisition time obtained with the optimized MRI sequence and the reference situation (standard sequence).
secondary_outcome.description: Time acquisition will be evaluated in minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of blurring and artefacts obtained by the optimized MRI sequence and the reference situation (standard sequence).
secondary_outcome.description: Absence of blurring and artefacts will be assessed by at least one radiologist according to an ordinal scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the spatial resolution obtained by the optimized MRI sequence and the reference situation (standard sequence).
secondary_outcome.description: Spatial resolution will be measured in mm².

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualification of the MRI acquisition for a clinical study.
secondary_outcome.description: Validation of MRI acquisition by a centralized review center.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of intra-subject reproducibility on the same MRI and on two MRIs.
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of intra-subject reproducibility on the same MRI and on two MRIs by the intra-class correlation coefficient for quantitative measurement or by the kappa coefficient for a qualitative measurement.

arm_group.arm_group_label: All subjects will have an MRI examination

intervention.description: All subjects (healthy subjects and patients) will have an MRI examination with optimized sequences
intervention.arm_group_label: All subjects will have an MRI examination

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for all subjects :
- to be over 18 year-old,
- to be able to understand the instructions given,
- to be enrolled in a social security plan,
- to have underwent a pre-inclusion medical examination,
- to give a written consent.
Inclusion Criteria especially for Patients :
- to perform a MRI examination of the head, neck, spine, thorax, abdomen, pelvis, retroperitoneum, lower limbs, upper limbs or whole body during clinical follow-up care.
Exclusion Criteria for all subjects :
- any contraindication to MR examination (active medical device, ferromagnetic foreign body, pregnancy, morbid obesity, claustrophobia, … ),
- subject under a measure of legal protection.
Exclusion Criteria especially for Healthy Subjects :
- to have a pathology in the anatomical area to be imaged
- to be employed by the CHRU of Nancy or having the slightest link of subordination with the CHRU of Nancy.
Exclusion Criteria especially for Patients :
- to have a limited MRI examination time due to a sensitive clinical situation (sedation, unstable hemodynamic state, postoperative).
